page.title: 20LIVING IN WOORE
page.content: We asked children about living in Woore. They liked some things, but thought some things were missing. {There is no proper playing-field}for children, and no kind of{centre}where children can just go. The things in Woore are clubs for special purposes like brownies or badminton. When children have been to a town like Telford, and seen all their sports centres and leisure centres, they are disappointed that{they can only go to {such places if their parents take them {in cars.} Mainly, the children play in their gardens or houses, or on the roads around Westfields. {At home}the children{watch television, {play computer games or listen to {records. Most children are quite happy to go back to school after a holiday, but they like their hoildays as well.
